required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Testosterone Nasal Gel in Hypogonadal Boys
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Open Label, Variable Dose, Two Arm Pilot Paediatric Phase 1 PK Study to Evaluate Testosterone Nasal Gel (4.5% w/w) in Hypogonadal Boys

brief_summary.textblock: PK study to evaluate serum levels of testosterone post nasal delivery in two cohorts of hypogonadal boys.

detailed_description.textblock:
ARM 1 - 10 prepubertal, 12-17 years old boys with no prior exposure to TRT will receive single dose of 5.5 mg on day one and single dose of 11 mg on day 2 with repeat blood draws to assess serum levels of testosterone and metabolites.
ARM 2 - 10 Tanner Stage 3, 12-17 years old boys on TRT with bone age >= 13 years will receive single dose of 11 mg on day one, and single dose of 11 mg in the morning and a second 11 mg dose in the afternoon on day 2 with repeat blood draws to assess serum levels of testosterone and metabolites.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: dual arm: naïve vs TRT experienced

primary_outcome.description: Cmax for serum testosterone, serum DHT and serum estradiol
AUC for serum testosterone, serum DHT and serum estradiol
Cmin for serum testosterone, serum DHT and serum estradiol

primary_outcome.measure: Time to reach maximum plasma concentration (tmax)
primary_outcome.description: tmax for serum testosterone, serum DHT and serum estradiol

secondary_outcome.description: Safety assessments will include adverse events, clinical laboratory measurements of serum testosterone, DHT and estradiol levels, and vital sign measurements. A phone call will be made 3 days after the patient leaves the clinic to collect any SAEs or AEs that may occur.
To include a adverse events that relate to tolerability and a patient and healthcare provider questionnaire on ease of use dispenser and gel administration

arm_group.description: TRT naïve subjects, Tanner Stage of 0, receiving Testosterone Nasal Gel [Natesto] - Single dose of 5.5 mg Natesto on Day 1 and a single dose of 11 mg Natesto on Day 2

TRT non-naïve subjects (have had prior testosterone treatment), Tanner Stage >/= 3, receiving Testosterone Nasal Gel [Natesto] - Single dose of 11 mg Natesto on Day 1. On Day 2, 11 mg dose of Natesto in the morning and 11 mg dose of Natesto 12 hours later

overall_official.affiliation: Royal Hospital for Children, U. of Glasgow

facility.name: University of Glasgow, Royal Hospital for Children
Cambridge University Hospital's NHS Foundation Trust
